org.michailov.async.io

Class CharRingBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.michailov.async.io.RingBuffer
      • org.michailov.async.io.CharRingBuffer

  • public class CharRingBuffer
extends RingBuffer
    This is a concrete implementation of RingBuffer of a char[].

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CharRingBuffer(char[] buffer)
      Constructs a ring buffer over an existing char[].
      CharRingBuffer(int capacity)
      Constructs a ring buffer over an implicitly allocated char[].

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char[] getBuffer()
      Gets the underlying char[].
      int peek(int delta)
      Gets the char at a given relative position ahead of the current virtual read position.
      int read()
      Reads the char at the virtual read position, and advances the virtual read position by 1.
      int write(char c)
      Writes a char at the virtual write position, and advances the virtual write position by 1.

      • Methods inherited from class org.michailov.async.io.RingBuffer

        advanceReadPosition, advanceWritePosition, getAvailableToRead, getAvailableToReadStraight, getAvailableToWrite, getAvailableToWriteStraight, getBufferLength, getReadPosition, getTotalReadCount, getTotalWriteCount, getWritePosition, isEOF, setEOF

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CharRingBuffer

        public CharRingBuffer(int capacity)
        Constructs a ring buffer over an implicitly allocated char[].
        Parameters:
        capacity - Capacity of the implicit char[].

      • CharRingBuffer

        public CharRingBuffer(char[] buffer)
        Constructs a ring buffer over an existing char[]. This overload is useful when the caller wants to reuse existing arrays to avoid unnecessary heap allocations.
        Parameters:
        buffer - An existing char[].

    • Method Detail

      • getBuffer

        public char[] getBuffer()
        Gets the underlying char[]. This may be passed to buffer copying APIs along with RingBuffer.getAvailableToReadStraight() or RingBuffer.getAvailableToWriteStraight().
        Returns:
        The underlying char[].

      • peek

        public int peek(int delta)
        Gets the char at a given relative position ahead of the current virtual read position.
        Parameters:
        delta - A relative position ahead of the virtual read position to peek at.
        Returns:
        The value of the char at the peek position or -1 if delta is greater than RingBuffer.getAvailableToRead().

      • read

        public int read()
        Reads the char at the virtual read position, and advances the virtual read position by 1.
        Returns:
        The char at the virtual read position or -1 if nothing is available to read.

      • write

        public int write(char c)
        Writes a char at the virtual write position, and advances the virtual write position by 1.
        Parameters:
        c - Char to be written.
        Returns:
        The char that was written or -1 if no space was available to write.
